availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Breathitt County, Kentucky, farmer. Perry County, Kentucky, native. Son of Alfred Combs and Margaret Combs. Farmer in Breathitt County in 1860. Appointed a justice of the peace in Breathitt County on December 19, 1860. Commissioned a captain in the 13th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (C. S. A.) in Whitesburg, Kentucky, on October 14, 1862.

bibl.p: Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Breathitt County, District No. 1, p. 84; Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky: Confederate Kentucky Volunteers War 1861-65, vol. 2 (Frankfort: Legislature of Kentucky, 1915), 164; KYR-0001-017-0039; Find A Grave, "Capt Henderson M Combs (1837 - 1863)," Memorial #46794717, https://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=46794717 (accessed September 21, 2017).
